meanings.definition: The act of removing national status or characteristics from something.
meanings.sent1: The denationalization of the company led to a loss of its national identity.
meanings.sent2: The denationalization of the flag symbolized a shift away from its original meaning.
meanings.sent3: During the denationalization of the school mascot, it lost its patriotic charm.
meanings.sent4: The denationalization of the currency felt like erasing its historical roots.
meanings.sent5: The denationalization of the anthem made it sound unfamiliar and distant.

meanings.definition: The process of transferring ownership or control of a business or industry from the government to private ownership.
meanings.sent1: The denationalization of the airline resulted in improved efficiency.
meanings.sent2: Investors were eager to participate in the denationalization of the telecommunications sector.
meanings.sent3: The denationalization of the bakery made the pastries taste even sweeter.
meanings.sent4: She compared the denationalization of the bookstore to setting a bird free from its cage.
meanings.sent5: The denationalization of the car manufacturer brought about innovative designs.
